AccountLinkInfo.title: A short description of struct
AccountLinkInfo.description: The information about the associated account.

authentication_type.description:
The type of the account. Valid values:

*   mobile: mobile number
*   email: email address
*   ding: DingTalk account
*   ram: Alibaba Cloud Resource Access Management (RAM) user
*   wechat: WeCom account
*   ldap: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) account
*   custom: custom account

identity.description: The unique identifier of the account.

extra.description: The additional information about the account. If the account type is a mobile number, the value of this parameter indicates the country code. For example, the country code in the Chinese mainland is 86 and a value of 86 is returned only if authentication_type is set to mobile.

user_id.description: The user ID of the account.

created_at.description: The time when the account was created. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

display_name.description: The display name of the account. For example, the unique identifier of an LDAP account is its UID, but the account display name can be the job number or other information.

AddressGroup.description: The information about the site group.

location.description: The latitude and longitude of the site.

count.description: The number of files in the site group.

cover_url.description: The URL of the cover image of the site.

cover_file_id.description: The ID of the cover image of the site.

AppAccessStrategy.description: The information about the access policy of the application.

effect.description:
The global access policy of the application. Valid values:

*   allow: The domain allows access from all applications.
*   deny: The domain denies access from all apps. This is the default value.

Recommended settings:

1.  Set effect to deny.
2.  Specify except_app_id_list to allow specific applications to access the domain. Example: \["appid1", "appid2"].

except_app_id_list.description:
The IDs of applications excluded from the global access policy.

*   If you set effect to allow, which indicates that the domain allows access from all applications, the applications specified by this parameter value cannot access the domain.
*   If you set effect to deny, which indicates that the domain denies access from all applications, the applications specified by this parameter value can access the domain.

parent_domain_id.description: The ID of the parent domain. If the parent domain exists, the current domain is a child domain. Otherwise, the current domain is a common domain.

description.description: The description of the domain.

init_drive_enable.description: Specifies whether to enable the default drive feature. Valid values: true and false. A value of true specifies that all users are assigned a drive by default on the first logon. Default value: false.

init_drive_size.description: The size of the default drive. Unit: bytes. This parameter is required if you set init_drive_enable to true. Default value: 0. A value of 0 indicates that the size of the default drive is 0 byte and you cannot upload files to the drive. To initialize the default drive, set init_drive_size to a positive number or -1. A value of -1 indicates that the size is unlimited.

updated_at.description: The time when the domain was last modified. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format.

created_at.description: The time when the domain was created. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format.

size_quota.description: The total storage quota for all drives in the domain. A value of 0 indicates that the quota is unlimited.

size_quota_used.description: The used storage quota of all drives in the domain.

user_count_quota.description: The maximum allowed number of users.

status.description: The status of the domain. 1: The domain runs normally. 2: The domain is being created. 6: The domain has expired.

used_size.description: The usage of the logic space. Unit: bytes.

published_app_access_strategy.description: The access policy of the application.

data_hash_name.title: domain hash type
data_hash_name.description: The method used to calculate the hash value of the data.

description.description: The description of the drive.

status.description: The status of the driver.

used_size.description: The occupied storage space of the drive.

total_size.description: The total storage space of the drive.

created_at.description: The time when the drive was created.

creator.description: The user who created the drive.

FaceGroup.description: The information about the face-based group.

group_id.description: The ID of the face-based group.

group_name.description: The name of the face-based group.

image_count.description: The number of photos in the face-based group.

created_at.description: The time when the face-based group was generated.

updated_at.description: The time when the face-based group was modified.

group_cover_url.description: The URL of the image used as the cover of the face-based group.

group_cover_file_id.description: The ID of the file used as the cover of the face-based group.

group_cover_width.description: The width of the image used as the cover of the face-based group.

group_cover_height.description: The height of the image used as the cover of the face-based group.

group_cover_face_boundary.description: The border of the image used as the cover the face-based group.

Width.description: The width of the border. Unit: pixel.

Height.description: The height of the border. Unit: pixel.

Top.description: The distance from the top of the photo to the border. Unit: pixel.

Left.description: The distance from the left side of the photo to the border. Unit: pixel.

FaceThumbnail.description: The information about the thumbnail of the face. This parameter is valid only if the value-added image processing feature is enabled.

face_group_id.description:
The ID of the group to which the face belongs.

The following specific IDs are included:

*   figure-cluster-id-independent: The face does not belong to a group. When you perform face clustering after an image is added to the dataset, this face may be grouped.
*   figure-cluster-id-unavailable: No clustering has been performed on this face. In other words, no face clustering is performed after an image is added to the dataset.

type.description:
The file type.

Valid values:

*   file
*   folder

created_at.description: The time when the file was created.

updated_at.description: The time when the file was modified.

description.description: The description of the file.

trashed_at.description: The time when the file was put into the recycle bin.

hidden.description: Specifies whether to hide the file.

size.description:
The file size

or folder size. The folder size is calculated based on all descendant files and folders in the folder. Note: The folder size can be returned only when you call the ListFile or GetFile operation and include the dir_size field in the fields parameter.

starred.description: Specifies whether to add the file to favorites.

status.description: The status of the file. Only files and directories in the available state can be accessed. If you call the GetFile operation to obtain a file that is in the uploading state, a response indicating that the file does not exist is returned. If you call the ListFile operation to query files, files in the uploading state are not returned.

content_hash.description: The hash value of the content.

content_hash_name.description: The name of the hash algorithm. Set the value to sha1.

download_url.description: The download URL. The default validity period of the download URL is 15 minutes. If the URL expires, you can obtain the URL by calling the GetFile operation.

thumbnail.description: The URL of the thumbnail. This parameter is deprecated and we recommend that you use thumbnail_urls.

category.description: The category. Drive and Photo Service (PDS) classifies files based on their extensions and mime-type. The supported categories include doc, image, audio, and video.

local_created_at.description: The time when the local file was created. The time refers to the local time when the file was uploaded. This parameter helps identify the local upload time.

local_modified_at.description: The time when the local file was modified. The time refers to the local time when the modified file was uploaded. This parameter helps identify the local update time.

revision_id.description: The version ID. If a file that has the same file ID with an existing one is uploaded, a new version ID is generated for the file.

status.description:
The status of the review.

Valid values:

*   0

    <!-- -->

    :

    <!-- -->

    The review is not performed

    <!-- -->

    .

*   1

    <!-- -->

    :

    The review is not supported

    <!-- -->

    The review fails

*   3

The recommended operation provided by the review.

Valid values:

*   pass

    The review is passed.

*   block

thumbnail_urls.description: The information about the returned thumbnail. The value corresponds to the key that is specified by thumbnail_processes.

additionalProperties.description: The information about the returned thumbnail. The value corresponds to the key that is specified by thumbnail_processes.

image_media_metadata.description: The image metadata. This parameter takes effect only if the value-added image processing feature is enabled.

dir_size_info.description: The information about the folder structure. This parameter is returned only if you include the dir_size field in the fields parameter by calling the ListFile or GetFile operation.

dir_count.description: The number of all descendant folders in the folder, which is calculated recursively.

file_count.description: The number of all descendant files in the folder, which is calculated recursively.

auto_delete_left_sec.description: The remaining time until the file is automatically deleted from the recycle bin (if in it).

identity.description: The identity to which the permissions are granted, which is a user or a group.

role_id.description:
The role ID. You can grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, or you can customize the permissions. To grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, specify role_id. role_id and action_list are mutually exclusive. If both parameters are specified, the value of role_id prevails.

Valid values:

SystemFileOwner: collaborator

SystemFileDownloader: downloader

SystemFileEditor: editor

SystemFileEditorWithoutDelete: editor without permissions to delete the file

SystemFileEditorWithoutShareLink: editor without permissions to share the file

SystemFileMetaViewer: viewer of lists

SystemFileUploader: uploader. SystemFileUploaderAndDownloader: uploader and downloader

SystemFileDownloaderWithShareLink: downloader and sharer

SystemFileUploaderAndDownloaderWithShareLink: uploader, downloader, and sharer

SystemFileUploaderAndViewer: viewer and uploader

SystemFileUploaderWithShareLink: uploader and sharer

SystemFileViewer: viewer

expire_time.description: The time when the permissions expire. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC. A value of 4775500800000 indicates that the permissions never expire.

disinherit_sub_group.description: Specifies whether the users of subgroups can inherit the permissions. For example, a user named user1 belongs to the group1 group, and a user named user2 belongs to the group2 group. group2 is the subgroup of group1. If you set disinherit_sub_group to true, only user1 is granted the permissions. user2 is not granted the permissions.

action_list.description: The list of permissions to grant. You can grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, or you can customize the permissions. To grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, specify role_id. role_id and action_list are mutually exclusive. If both parameters are specified, the value of role_id prevails. When you specify action_list, the system automatically generates a temporary role_id. You can use this role_id to revoke the permissions.

items.description:
The permission. Valid values:

*   FILE.VISIBLE
*   FILE.PREVIEW
*   FILE.MOVE
*   FILE.DELETE
*   FILE.COPY
*   FILE.CREATE
*   FILE.DOWNLOAD
*   FILE.SHARELINK
*   FILE.UPDATE
*   FILE.LIST

description.description: The description of the group.

created_at.description: The time when the group was created. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

updated_at.description: The time when the group was modified. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

creator.description: The ID of the user who created the group.

Identity.title: A short description of struct
Identity.description: The identity to which the permissions are granted, which is a user or a group.

identity_type.description:
The type of the identity. Valid values:

*   IT_User
*   IT_Group

identity_id.title: ID
identity_id.description: The ID of the user or the group.

ImageMediaMetadata.title: A short description of struct
ImageMediaMetadata.description: The image metadata. This parameter is valid only if the value-added image processing feature is enabled.

time.description: The time when the image was taken. The time follows the RFC3339 standard.

width.description: The width of the image. Unit: pixel.

height.description: The height of the image. Unit: pixel.

country.description: The country or region in which the image was taken.

province.description: The province in which the image was taken.

city.description: The city in which the image was taken.

district.description: The district in which the image was taken.

township.description: The street in which the image was taken.

address_line.example: Jiangling Road, Xixing Street, Binjiang District, Hangzhou, Zhejiang

image_tags.description: The details of the image tags.

items.description: The system tag.(this data structure will be closed in Feb. 20,2025)

faces.description: The human faces that are contained in the image.

exif.description: The EXIF information about the image.

image_thumbnail_process.description: The thumbnail processing rules for images. For more information, see the "IMG implementation modes" topic of Object Storage Service (OSS). Default value: image/resize,m_fill,h\_128,w\_128,limit\_0.

video_thumbnail_process.description: The thumbnail processing rules for videos. For more information, see the "Video snapshots" topic of OSS. Default value: video/snapshot,t\_1000,f_jpg,w\_0,h\_0,m_fast,ar_auto.

office_thumbnail_process.description: The thumbnail processing rules for documents. For a document, the snapshot of one of the pages in the document is used as the thumbnail. This parameter takes effect on this snapshot. Default value: image/resize,m_fill,h\_128,w\_128,limit\_0.

ImageQuality.description: The details of the image quality. This parameter takes effect only if the value-added image processing feature is enabled.

overall_score.description: The overall quality score of the image. The image is automatically evaluated by AI. The evaluation is mainly based on subjective aesthetics and is affected by various factors, such as composition, brightness, contrast, color, and definition. Valid values: 0 to 1. The higher the score, the better the quality.

ImageTag.description: The information about the image tag.

count.description: The number of files in the group.

cover_url.description: The URL of the cover image.

cover_file_id.description: The ID of the cover file.

cover_file_category.description: The category of the cover image.

cover_tag_confidence.description: The confidence level of the cover image tag.

cover_overall_score.description: The score of the cover image.

created_at.description: The time when the version was created.

updated_at.description: The time when the version was modified.

keep_forever.description: Indicates whether the version is permanently retained.

is_latest_version.description: Indicates whether it is the latest version.

crc64_hash.title: crc64
crc64_hash.description: The CRC64 value of the version.

content_hash.description: The hash value of the content.

content_hash_name.description: The name of the hash algorithm.

download_url.description: The download URL. The ListRevision operation does not return this value. The GetRevision, UpdateRevision, and RestoreRevision operations return this value.

creator_id.description: The ID of the user who created the version.

creator_name.description: The name of the user who created the version.

description.description: The description of the role.

manage_resource_type.description: The type of the resource on which the role has permissions. Valid value: RT_File.

creator.description: The ID of the user who created the role.

created_at.description: The time when the role was created. The value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

updated_at.description: The time when the role was modified. The value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

status.description: The status of the role.

share_pwd.description: The access code. An access code can be up to 64 characters in length. If you do not specify a value, files can be accessed without an access code.

file_id_list.description: The IDs of the files to share in the parent path.

expiration.description: The time when the share URL expires. The value of this parameter follows the RFC 3339 standard. Example: "2020-06-28T11:33:00.000+08:00". If you set the value to "", the share URL never expires.

expired.description: Specifies whether the share is expired.

created_at.description: The time when the share was created.

updated_at.description: The time when the share was last modified.

description.description: The description of the share.

share_name.description: The name of the share. By default, the file name that corresponds to the first ID in the file ID list is used.

creator.description: The user who created the share.

status.description:
The status of the share. Valid values:

*   disabled: The share is canceled.
*   enabled: The share is effective.

preview_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are previewed.

save_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are saved.

download_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are downloaded.

report_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are reported.

video_preview_count.description: The number of times that the shared audio and video files are played.

access_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are visited.

disable_preview.description: Specifies whether to disable the preview feature.

disable_save.description: Specifies whether to disable the save feature.

disable_download.description: Specifies whether to disable the download feature.

preview_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be previewed.

save_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be saved.

download_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be downloaded.

share_all_files.description: Specifies whether to share all files in the drive.

story_type.description: The type of the story. It is specified when the story is created.

story_sub_type.description: The subtype of the story. It is specified when the story is created.

story_start_time.description: The time when the story starts. The time follows the RFC3339 standard.

story_end_time.description: The time when the story ends. The time follows the RFC3339 standard.

created_at.description: The time when the story was created. The time follows the RFC3339 standard.

updated_at.description: The time when the story was updated. The time follows the RFC3339 standard.

face_group_ids.description: The information about face-based groups. This parameter is valid only if story_type is set to PeopleMemory. This parameter is invalid for stories of other types or custom stories.

items.description: The ID of the face-based group.

cover_file_id.description: The ID of the story cover file.

cover_file_thumbnail_url.description: The URL of thumbnail of the story cover file.

custom_labels.description: The custom tags. You can specify key-value pairs based on your business requirements to search for stories by calling the FindStories operation.

SystemTag.description: The system AI processing tag. This parameter is valid only if the value-added image processing feature is enabled.(this data structure will be closed in Feb. 20,2025)

confidence.description: The confidence level of the tag. Valid values: 0 to 1. A value of 0 specifies the lowest confidence level. A value of 1 specifies the highest confidence level.

parent_name.description: The name of the parent tag of the tag.

tag_level.description: The level of the tag. The value must be greater than or equal to 1.

centric_score.description: The center value of the tag, which specifies whether the tag is the subject in the image. Valid values: 0 to 1. A value of 0 specifies the lowest proportion. A value of 1 specifies the highest proportion.

Token.title: A short description of struct
Token.description: The object that is returned after the authentication is complete, including the access token, refresh token, and basic information about the user.

expires_in.description: The validity period of the token.

token_type.description:
The type of the token.

*   Only Bearer is supported.

avatar.description: The profile picture of the user.

default_drive_id.description: The ID of the default space of the user.

status.description: The status of the user.

expire_time.description: The time when the credential expires.

is_first_login.description: Indicates whether this is the first logon of the user.

device_id.description: The ID of the device that is bound to OAuth 2.0 Device Authorization Grant.

device_name.description: The name of the device that is bound to OAuth 2.0 Device Authorization Grant.

UploadPartInfo.description: The information about the file part.

part_number.description: The serial number of the file part.

upload_url.description: The upload URL. By default, the validity period of the URL is 15 minutes. If the URL expires, you must call the GetUploadUrl operation to obtain another URL. If the intelligent domain name feature is enabled, the internal_upload_url value is returned within the parameter based on the request.

internal_upload_url.description: The internal upload URL that is used for internal access over a virtual private cloud (VPC). If the intelligent domain name feature is enabled, this parameter is not required. This parameter is returned in the upload_url parameter based on the request. If you want to use this parameter, contact Photo and Drive Service (PDS) technical support.

parallel_sha1_ctx.description: The Secure Hash Algorithm 1 (SHA-1) context of the previous part. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

h.description: The first to fifth 32-bit variables in the SHA-1 context of the previous part. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

part_offset.description: The total size of all the previous parts. Unit: bytes. The value must be a multiple of 64. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

parallel_sha256_ctx.description: The SHA-256 context of the previous part.

h.description: The first to eighth 32-bit variables in the SHA-256 context of the previous part.

part_offset.description: The total size of all the previous parts. Unit: bytes. The value must be a multiple of 64.

created_at.description: The time when the user was created. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

updated_at.description: The time when the user was modified. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

email.description: The email address of the user.

phone.description: The mobile number of the user.

role.description:
The role of the user. Valid values:

*   superadmin
*   admin
*   user

status.description:
The status of the user. Valid values:

*   disabled: The user is prohibited from logon.
*   enabled: The user is in a normal state.

description.description: The description of the user.

user_data.description: The custom data of the user.

creator.description: The user who created the user.

UserTag.title: A short description of struct
UserTag.description: The information about the user tag.

key.title: key
key.description: The tag key. This parameter must be specified and the tag key cannot contain number signs (#). The tag key and tag value cannot exceed 2,000 bytes in length in total.

Value.title: value
Value.description: The tag value. The tag value cannot contain number signs (#). The tag key and tag value cannot exceed 2,000 bytes in length in total.

width.description: The width of the video image. Unit: pixel.

height.description: The height of the video image. Unit: pixel.

video_media_video_stream.description: The information about the video stream.

video_media_audio_stream.description: The information about the audio stream.

VideoPreviewSubtitleInfo.description: The information about the subtitle task.

status.description:
The status of the subtitle task.

Valid values:

*   finished
*   failed

domain_name.description: If you want to perform secondary operations based on Drive and Photo Service and perform fine-grained control on your tenants, you can use the parent-child domain feature of Drive and Photo Service. For more information, join the DingTalk group whose ID is 23146118.

description.description: domain 描述
description.example: 你好企业网盘开发环境

size_quota.description: The ID of the parent domain. If you want to create a child domain, specify parent_domain_id. In most cases, you do not need to create a child domain. If you want to perform secondary operations based on Drive and Photo Service, contact the customer service.

Token.summary: Generates an access token based on Open Authorization (OAuth) 2.0.

schema.description:
The method that is used to generate an access token. Valid values:

authorization_code: generates an access token by using the authorization code that is returned after the authorization process is complete.

refresh_token: generates an access token by using the refresh token that is returned after the authorization process is complete.

urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer: generates an access token by using a JWT assertion.
The authorization code in the redirect URI that is specified after the authorization process is complete. This parameter is required if grant_type is set to authorization_code.
The redirect URI that is specified when you initiate the authorization request. This parameter is required if grant_type is set to authorization_code.
The AppId of the application that is created in the Drive and Photo Service console.
The AppSecret of the application that is created in the Drive and Photo Service console. This parameter is required if the application is of the WebServer type.
The refresh token that is used to refresh the access token. This parameter is required if grant_type is set to refresh_token.

The JWT assertion that is signed by using the JWT private key. The JWT assertion contains the information about the user to be authorized and the authorization parameters. For more information about the structure of the JWT assertion, see JWTPayload. This parameter is required if grant_type is set to urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer.
The information about the access token.

name.title: 文件或文件夹名称
name.description: The name of the file. The name can be up to 1,024 bytes in length based on the UTF-8 encoding rule and cannot contain forward slash (/).

The type of the file. Valid values:

file folder

parent_file_id.title: 父文件夹id
parent_file_id.description: The ID of the parent directory. If you want to create a file or folder in the root directory, set this parameter to root.

drive_id.title: 用户空间id
drive_id.description: The drive ID. This parameter is required if the file is not uploaded by using the share URL of the file.

share_id.title: 共享id
share_id.description: The share ID. This parameter is required if the file is uploaded by using the share URL of the file.

size.title: 文件大小
size.description: The size of the file. Unit: bytes.

content_type.title: 文件类型
content_type.description: The type of the file content. Default value: application/oct-stream.

part_info_list.description: The information about the file parts. You can specify up to 10,000 parts. By default, if you do not specify this parameter, only one part is returned.

part_number.description: The serial number of a file part. The number starts from 1.

parallel_sha1_ctx.description: The SHA-1 hash value of the file content before the file part. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

h.description: The first to fifth 32-bit variables of the SHA-1 hash value of the file content before the file part. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

items.description: The first to fifth 32-bit variables of the SHA-1 hash value of the file content before the file part.

part_offset.description: The size of the file content before the file part. Unit: bytes. The value must be a multiple of 64. This parameter takes effect only if the parallel upload feature is enabled.

content_md5.description: The MD5 hash value of the file part. This parameter is required when the MD5 hash value of the file part needs to be verified during part upload.

user_tags.title: 用户打标
user_tags.description: The custom tags. You can specify up to 1,000 tags.

hidden.description: Specifies whether to hide the file or folder. By default, the file or folder is not hidden.

description.title: 描述信息
description.description: The description of the file. The description can be up to 1,024 characters in length. By default, this parameter is left empty.

content_hash.title: 内容hash
content_hash.description: The hash value of the file content. The value is calculated based on the algorithm specified by content_hash_name.

content_hash_name.title: 内容hash算法名
content_hash_name.description: The name of the algorithm that is used to calculate the hash value of the file content. Only SHA1 is supported.

pre_hash.description: The SHA-1 hash value of the first 1 KB data of the file. This parameter is required if you perform instant file upload by using the pre-hashing feature. If the SHA-1 hash value is not matched on the cloud, the client does not need to calculate the SHA-1 hash value of the entire file.

check_name_mode.title: 重命名模式
check_name_mode.description:
The processing method that is used if the file that you want to create has the same name as an existing file in the cloud. Valid values:

ignore: allows you to create the file by using the same name as an existing file in the cloud.

auto_rename: automatically renames the file that you want to create. By default, the current point in time is added to the end of the file name. Example: xxx\_20060102\_150405.

refuse: does not create the file that you want to create but returns the information about the file that has the same name in the cloud.

Default value: ignore.

file_id.title: 文件id
file_id.description: The file ID. This parameter is required if check_name_mode is set to ignore.

local_created_at.title: 文件本地创建时间
local_created_at.description: The time when the local file was created. By default, this parameter is left empty. Specify the time in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format based on the UTC+0 time zone.

local_modified_at.title: 本地文件修改时间
local_modified_at.description: The time when the local file was modified. By default, this parameter is left empty. Specify the time in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format based on the UTC+0 time zone.

image_media_metadata.description: The information about the image specified by the client.

video_media_metadata.description: The information about the video specified by the client.

parallel_upload.description: Specifies whether to enable the parallel upload feature.

parent_file_id.title: 父目录文件id
parent_file_id.description: The ID of the parent directory.

part_info_list.title: 分段信息
part_info_list.description: The information about the file parts.

items.description: The information about a file part.

upload_id.title: 上传id
upload_id.description: The ID of the upload task.

rapid_upload.title: 是否已经秒传
rapid_upload.description: Indicates whether the file is instantly uploaded.

status.title: 文件状态
status.description: The state of the file.

drive_id.title: drive id 如果要删除drive下的文件时，drive_id时必需的参数

file_id.title: file_id是文件的唯一标识，删除文件或者目录时必须指定file_id
file_id.description: The file ID or folder ID.

async_task_id.description: The ID of the asynchronous task. This parameter is returned only in asynchronous processing scenarios. You can call the [GetAsyncTask](~~440456~~) operation to query the information about the asynchronous task based on the task ID.

name.description: The name of the file. The name can be up to 1,024 bytes in length based on the UTF-8 encoding rule.

description.description: The description of the file. The description can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

labels.description: The tags of the file. You can specify up to 100 tags.

items.description: The tag of the file. The tag can be up to 128 characters in length.

check_name_mode.description:
The processing method that is used if the file that you want to modify has the same name as an existing file on the cloud. Valid values:

ignore: allows you to modify the file by using the same name as an existing file on the cloud.

auto_rename: automatically renames the file that has the same name on the cloud. By default, the current point in time is added to the end of the file name. Example: xxx\_20060102\_150405.

refuse: does not modify the file that you want to modify but returns the information about the file that has the same name on the cloud.

Default value: ignore.

local_modified_at.description: The local time when the file was modified. The time is in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format based on the UTC+0 time zone.

hidden.description: Specifies whether to hide the file.

starred.description: Specifies whether to add the file to favorites.

UpdateFile.title: UpdateFile

query.description: The search conditions. Fuzzy searches based on the file name or directory name are supported. The value of this parameter can be up to 4,096 characters in length.

order_by.description:
The field by which to sort the returned entries. Default value: created_at. Valid values:

*   created_at: sorts the entries by creation time.
*   updated_at: sorts the entries by update time.
*   size: sorts the entries by file size.
*   name: sorts the entries by file name.

The order in which you want to sort the returned entries. Valid values:

*   ASC: ascending order
*   DESC: descending order

You must specify this parameter in the \<field> \<ASC or DESC> format. Separate multiple fields with commas (,). A preceding field has a higher priority than a following field. Examples:

*   If you want to sort the entries by file name in ascending order, set this parameter to "name ASC".
*   If you want to sort the entries by creation time in descending order, set this parameter to "created_at DESC".
*   If you want to sort the entries by creation time in descending order and sort the entries by file name in ascending order in case of the same creation time, set this parameter to "created_at DESC,name ASC".

limit.description:
The maximum number of entries to return. Valid values: 1 to 100.

The number of returned entries must be less than or equal to the value of this parameter.

marker.description:
The name of the entry after which the list begins. Entries whose names are alphabetically after the value of this parameter are returned. If you do not specify this parameter, all entries are returned.\
This parameter is left empty by default.

return_total_count.description: Specifies whether to return the total number of retrieved files.

recursive.description: Specifies whether to perform recursive search on a folder that is specified by setting parent_file_id in the query parameter.

thumbnail_processes.description: The thumbnail configurations. Up to five thumbnails can be returned at a time. The value contains key-value pairs. You can customize the keys. The URL of a thumbnail is returned based on the key.

additionalProperties.description: The rules used to generate the thumbnails of images, videos, and documents.

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

total_count.description: The total number of retrieved files.

SearchFile.title: SearchFile

ListFile.summary: Queries a list of files and folders.

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to share a file, carry the `x-share-token` header for authentication in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify one of `share_id` and `drive_id`.

parent_file_id.description: The ID of the parent folder. If the parent folder is a root directory, set this parameter to root.

limit.description:
The maximum number of results to return. Valid values: 1 to 100.

The number of returned entries must be less than or equal to the value of this parameter.

marker.description:
The name of the entry after which the list begins. Entries whose names are alphabetically after the value of this parameter are returned. If you do not specify this parameter, all entries are returned.\
This parameter is left empty by default.

status.description:
The state of the files to return. Valid values:

available: returns only normal files. uploading: returns only files that are being uploaded.

By default, only files in the available state are returned.

order_by.description:
The sorting field. Valid values:

created_at: sorts the entries by creation time. updated_at: sorts the entries by update time. size: sorts the entries by file size. name: sorts the entries by file name.

Default value: created_at.

Enumeration:

*   updated_at: update time
*   size: file size
*   name: file name
*   created_at: creation time

order_direction.description:
The sorting direction. Valid values:

ASC: ascending order DESC: descending order

Default value: ASC.

category.description:
The file category. Valid values:

app: installation package zip: compressed package image doc: document video audio others

By default, files of all categories are returned.

type.description:
The file type. Valid values:

file: returns only files. folder: returns only folders.

By default, files of all types are returned.

fields.description:
The field that is used to return additional information about a child subject. Valid values:

*   url: returns the URL of the thumbnail of a file in the response.
*   exif: returns the Exchangeable Image File Format (EXIF) data of a file in the response.
*   cropping_suggestion: returns the cropping suggestion on a file in the response.
*   characteristic_hash: returns the characteristic hash value of a file in the response.
*   video_metadata: returns the metadata of a video file, such as the video duration, bitrate, height, and width, in the response.
*   video_preview_metadata: returns the transcoding information of a video file, such as the transcoding specification for each definition, in the response.
*   investigation_info: returns the investigation information in the response.
*   dir_size: returns the statistics on each subfolder in the response.
*   user_tags: returns the user tags of each child subject in the response.

You can specify multiple fields by separating them with commas (,). Example: "url,dir_size,user_tags".

thumbnail_processes.description: The thumbnail configurations. Up to five thumbnails can be returned at a time. The value contains key-value pairs. You can customize the keys. The URL of a thumbnail is returned based on the key.

additionalProperties.description: The rules used to generate the thumbnails of images, videos, and documents.

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

ListFile.title: ListFile

GetFile.summary: Queries the information about a file.

url_expire_sec.description: The time when the file expires. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 10 to 14400.

fields.description:
The fields to return.

1.  If this parameter is set to \*, all fields of the file except the fields that must be specified are returned.
2.  If only specific fields are required, you can specify the following fields: url, thumbnail, exif, cropping_suggestion, characteristic_hash, video_metadata, and video_preview_metadata. If multiple fields are required, separate them with commas (,). Example: url,thumbnail.
3.  The investigation_info field is returned only if you specify this field.

By default, all fields except the fields that must be specified are returned.

thumbnail_processes.description: 缩略图配置，可一次性返回最多5个缩略图，map的key可以自定义，返回时按key返回对应的缩略图链接

additionalProperties.description: 定义图片、视频、文档的缩略图处理规则

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to manage a file by using a share link, carry the `x-share-token` header for authentication in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify one of `share_id` and `drive_id`.

CompleteFile.title: CompleteFile

to_parent_file_id.description: The ID of the destination parent directory to which you want to move a file or folder. If you want to move a file or folder to the root directory, set this parameter to root.

check_name_mode.description:
The processing method that is used if the file that you want to move has the same name as an existing file in the destination directory. Valid values:

ignore: allows you to move the file by using the same name as an existing file in the destination directory.

auto_rename: automatically renames the file that has the same name exists in the destination directory. By default, the current point in time is added to the end of the file name. Example: xxx\_20060102\_150405.

refuse: does not move the file that you want to move but returns the information about the file that has the same name in the destination directory.

Default value: ignore.

async_task_id.description:
The ID of the asynchronous task.

If an empty string is returned, the file is moved.

If a non-empty string is returned, an asynchronous task is required. You can call the GetAsyncTask operation to obtain the information about an asynchronous task based on the task ID.

exist.description: Indicates whether the file already exists in the destination directory.

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to manage a file by using a share link, carry the `x-share-token` header for authentication in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify one of `share_id` and `drive_id`.

file_id.description: The file ID or folder ID.

to_drive_id.description: The ID of the drive to which you want to copy the file or folder. Default value: the value of drive_id.

to_parent_file_id.description: The ID of the destination parent folder. If you want to copy the file or folder to a root directory, set this parameter to root.

auto_rename.description: Specifies whether to automatically rename the file if the file name already exists in the destination folder. Default value: false.

file_id.description: The ID of the copied file or folder.

async_task_id.description:
The ID of the asynchronous task.

If a file is copied, this parameter is not returned. If a folder is copied, the folder is asynchronously copied in the background and this parameter is returned. You can call the GetAsyncTask operation to query the information about the asynchronous task based on the task ID.

GetDownloadUrl.summary: Queries the download URL of a file. For more information about best practices, visit https://help.aliyun.com/document_detail/175889.html.

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to manage a file by using a sharing link, carry the `x-share-token` header in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify at least either `share_id` or `drive_id`.

file_name.description: The name of the file. The name can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

expire_sec.description: The validity period of the download URL. Maximum value: 115200. Default value: 900. Unit: seconds.

url.title: Id of the request
url.description: The download URL of a file that is downloaded over the Internet.

internal_url.description: The download URL of a file that is downloaded over a virtual private cloud (VPC).

cdn_url.description: The download URL of a file that is downloaded by using Alibaba Cloud CDN.

expiration.description: The time when the download URL expires.

size.description: The size of the file. Unit: bytes.

crc64_hash.description: The hash value calculated by using 64-bit cyclic redundancy check (CRC-64).

content_hash.description: The hash value of the file content.

content_hash_name.description: The name of the algorithm that is used to calculate the hash value of the file content.

value.description: The value of the tag. The tag value cannot contain number signs (#).

This operation is an incremental update operation. Take note of the following items:

*   If a tag name specified in the request is the same as an existing tag name, the existing tag is overwritten.
*   If a tag name specified in the request is different from the existing tag names, the specified tag is added.
*   The existing tags with unique names are not affected.

ListReceivedFile.summary: Queries a list of files that are shared with a user. You can call this operation to query a list of files in a personal drive on which a user is granted permissions.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. Valid values: 1 to 100. Default value: 100.

marker.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of marker. By default, this parameter is empty.

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

ListReceivedFile.title: ListReceivedFile

ListMyGroupDrive.summary: Queries the team drives that can be accessed by the authorized users.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. Valid values: 1 to 100. Default value: 100.

marker.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of marker. By default, this parameter is left empty.

items.description: The information about the team drives.
The information about a team drive.

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

ListMyGroupDrive.title: ListMyGroupDrive

FileRemovePermission.summary: Cancels the permissions on a shared file.

member_list.description: The identities with whom the file is shared.

identity.description: The identity to whom the permissions are granted, which is a user or a group.

role_id.description:
The role ID. You can grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, or you can customize the permissions. To grant permissions by assigning roles to identities, specify role_id. role_id and action_list are mutually exclusive. If both parameters are specified, role_id has a higher priority.

Valid values:

SystemFileOwner: collaborator.

SystemFileDownloader: downloader.

SystemFileEditor: editor.

SystemFileEditorWithoutDelete: editor without permissions to delete the file.

SystemFileEditorWithoutShareLink: editor without permissions to share the file.

SystemFileMetaViewer: viewer of lists.

SystemFileUploader: uploader. SystemFileUploaderAndDownloader: uploader and downloader.

SystemFileDownloaderWithShareLink: downloader and sharer.

SystemFileUploaderAndDownloaderWithShareLink: uploader, downloader, and sharer.

SystemFileUploaderAndViewer: viewer and uploader.

SystemFileUploaderWithShareLink: uploader and sharer.

SystemFileViewer: viewer.

FileRemovePermission.title: FileRemovePermission

FileAddPermission.summary: Grants permissions to access files to a user or group.

file_id.description: The ID of the folder. If you want to authorize a user or group to access a team drive, set this parameter to root. If you want to authorize a user or group to access an individual drive, you cannot set this parameter to root.

member_list.description: The members that are authorized to access files.

FileAddPermission.title: FileAddPermission

FileListPermission.summary: Queries the sharing authorization records of a file.

schema.description: The information about the sharing authorization records of a file.

items.description: The information about a sharing authorization record of a file.

FileListPermission.title: FileListPermission

ListAssignment.summary: Queries a list of assigned roles. For example, you can query the administrators of a group by group ID.

manage_resource_type.description: The type of the managed resource. Set the value to RT_Group, which specifies that the administrators of a group are queried.

manage_resource_id.description: The ID of the managed resource, such as a group ID.

marker.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of marker. By default, this parameter is empty.

limit.description:
The maximum number of results to return. Valid values: 1 to 100.

The number of returned results must be less than or equal to the specified number.

identity.description: The identity to whom the role is assigned, which is a user or a group.

role_id.description: The ID of the role assigned to the identity.

manage_resource_type.description: The type of the managed resource. For example, a value of RT_Group indicates group.

manage_resource_id.description: The ID of the managed resource, such as a group ID.

creator.description: The ID of the user who assigned the role.

created_at.description: The time when the role was assigned. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

ListAssignment.title: ListAssignment

AssignRole.summary: Assigns a group administrator role to a user.

identity.description: The unique identifier of a user. The group administrator role can only be assigned to a user.

role_id.description: The ID of the role that is assigned to a user. Valid value: SystemGroupAdmin.

manage_resource_type.description: The type of the resource that the role can manage. Valid value: RT_Group.

manage_resource_id.description: The ID of the resource that the role can manage. You can only set this parameter to the ID of a group.

AssignRole.title: AssignRole
AssignRole.description: You can call this operation to assign a group administrator role to a user.

identity.description: The unique identifier. You can cancel only the role assigned to a user.

role_id.description: The ID of the role to be canceled. Set the value to SystemGroupAdmin, which is the ID of the group administrator role.

manage_resource_type.description: The type of the resource that the role manages. Set the value to RT_Group, which specifies group.

manage_resource_id.description: The ID of the resource that the role manages. Set the value to a group ID.

CancelAssignRole.title: CancelAssignRole
CancelAssignRole.description: You can cancel only the group administrator role.

share_all_files.description: Specifies whether to share all files in the drive.

file_id_list.description: The IDs of the files to share in the parent path. The number of files in the parent path ranges from 1 to 100. If share_all_files is set to true, this parameter does not take effect. Otherwise, you must specify this parameter.``

items.description: The ID of the file to share in the parent path.

share_pwd.description: The access code. An access code must be 0 to 64 bytes in length. If you do not specify this parameter or leave this parameter empty, the files can be accessed without an access code. In this case, you do not need to specify the share_pwd parameter when you call an operation to query the share URL. The access code can contain only visible ASCII characters.

expiration.description: The time when the share URL expires. The value of this parameter follows the RFC 3339 standard. Example: "2020-06-28T11:33:00.000+08:00". If expiration is set to "", the share URL never expires.

description.description: The description of the share. The description must be 0 to 1,024 characters in length.

share_name.description: The name of the share. If you leave this parameter empty, the file name that corresponds to the first ID in the file ID list is used. The name must be 0 to 128 characters in length.

disable_preview.description: Specifies whether to disable the preview feature.

disable_save.description: Specifies whether to disable the dump feature.

disable_download.description: Specifies whether to disable the download feature.

preview_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be previewed. The value of this parameter must be equal to or greater than 0. A value of 0 indicates no limit.

save_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be dumped. The value of this parameter must be equal to or greater than 0. A value of 0 indicates no limit.

download_limit.description: The limit on the number of times that the shared files can be downloaded. The value of this parameter must be equal to or greater than 0. A value of 0 indicates no limit.

CreateShareLink.title: CreateShareLink
CreateShareLink.description: A share is a file view container. You can grant anonymous users the permissions to access files in the user drive by using the share URL. Anonymous users can access the files based on the granted permissions.

share_pwd.description: The access code. The access code can be up to 64 characters in length. A value of 0 specifies an empty string.

expiration.description: The time when the share link expires. The time follows the RFC 3339 standard. Example: 2020-06-28T11:33:00.000+08:00. If you leave this parameter empty, the share link never expires.

description.description: The description of the share link. The description can be up to 1,024 characters in length.

share_name.description: The name of the share link. By default, the name of the first file is used. The name can be up to 128 characters in length.

status.description:
The state of the share link. Valid values:

*   disabled: The share link is canceled.
*   enabled: The share link is effective.

preview_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are previewed. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

save_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are saved. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

download_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are downloaded. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

report_count.description: The number of times that the shared files are reported. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

video_preview_count.description: The number of times that the videos are previewed in the shared files. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.

disable_preview.description: Specifies whether to prohibit the previews of the shared files.

disable_save.description: Specifies whether to prohibit the saves of the shared files.

disable_download.description: Specifies whether to prohibit the downloads of the shared files.

preview_limit.description: The maximum number of times that the shared files can be previewed. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. A value of 0 specifies that the number is unlimited.

save_limit.description: The maximum number of times that the shared files can be saved. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. A value of 0 specifies that the number is unlimited.

download_limit.description: The maximum number of times that the shared files can be downloaded. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. A value of 0 specifies that the number is unlimited.

UpdateShareLink.title: UpdateShareLink

limit.description:
The maximum number of results to return. Valid values: 1 to 100. Default value: 100.

The number of returned results must be less than or equal to the specified number.

marker.description:
The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of marker.\
By default, this parameter is left empty.

return_total_count.description: Specifies whether to return the total number of returned results.

order_by.description:
The field by which to sort the returned results. Default value: created_at. Valid values:

*   share_name: sorts the results by the name of the share.
*   updated_at: sorts the results by the time when the share was modified.
*   description: sorts the results by the description of the share.
*   created_at: sorts the results by the time when the share was created.

order_direction.description:
The order in which you want to sort the returned results. By default, order_direction is set to DESC if order_by is set to created_at or updated_at, and is set to ASC if order_by is set to other values. Valid values:

*   ASC: sorts the results in ascending order.
*   DESC: sorts the results in descending order.

creators.description:
The creators of shares. Set this parameter to a user ID. If you do not specify this parameter, Drive and Photo Service automatically queries shares based on your permissions. If you are a drive administrator or the super administrator, the shares created by all members are queried. If you are a team administrator, the shares created by all team members are queried. If you are a common user, only the shares created by yourself are queried.

If you specify this parameter, this parameter must be set to the ID of the super administrator, a drive administrator, or a team administrator.

query.description: The query condition that is used to search for share URLs. You can use the following fields to specify query conditions: created_at: queries a share URL based on the time when the share URL was created. updated_at: queries a share URL based on the time when the share URL was modified. share_name_for_fuzzy: queries a share URL based on the name of the share. A fuzzy match is supported. status: queries a share URL based on the status of the share. Valid values: enabled and disabled. A value of enabled indicates that the share is valid. A value of disabled indicates that the share is canceled. expired_time: queries a share URL based on the expiration time of the share. If the share never expires, set this field to 1970-01-01T00:00:00. Otherwise, set this field to 1970-01-02T00:00:00.
query.example: created_at>='2022-01-18T02:50:00' and created_at<'2022-01-19T09:45:28' and share_name_for_fuzzy match 'HD.mp4' and status in ['enabled', 'disabled'] and expired_time='1970-01-01T00:00:00'

next_marker.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. If next_marker is empty, no next page exists.

total_count.description: The total number of entries returned.

The number of returned entries must be less than or equal to the value of this parameter.

fields.description:
The fields of an entry (file or folder) to return.

1\. If you set this parameter to \*, all fields are returned.

finished_at.description: The time when the task was complete. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. Example: 2019-03-28T13:03:29.298Z.

GetVideoPreviewPlayMeta.summary: Queries the preview metadata of a video.

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to manage a file by using a sharing link, carry the `x-share-token` header in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify at least either `share_id` or `drive_id`.

category.description:
The preview type. You must enable the corresponding video transcoding feature. Valid values:

*   live_transcoding: previews a live stream while transcoding is in progress.
*   quick_video: previews a video while transcoding is in progress.
*   offline_audio: previews a piece of audio after the audio is transcoded offline.
*   offline_video: previews a video after the video is transcoded offline.

video_preview_play_meta.description: The preview metadata of the video.

GetVideoPreviewPlayMeta.title: GetVideoPreviewPlayMeta
GetVideoPreviewPlayMeta.description: For more information about best practices, see [Preview videos online](~~427477~~).

GetVideoPreviewPlayInfo.summary: Queries the information about video playback.

share_id.description: The share ID. If you want to manage a file by using a sharing link, carry the `x-share-token` header in the request and specify share_id. In this case, `drive_id` is invalid. Otherwise, use an `AccessKey pair` or `access token` for authentication and specify `drive_id`. You must specify at least either `share_id` or `drive_id`.

category.description:
The preview type. You must enable the corresponding video transcoding feature. Valid values:

*   live_transcoding: previews a live stream while transcoding is in progress.
*   quick_video: previews a video while transcoding is in progress.
*   offline_audio: previews a piece of audio after the audio is transcoded offline.
*   offline_video: previews a video after the video is transcoded offline.

template_id.description: The ID of the definition template. If you leave this parameter empty, all definition templates are available.

get_without_url.description: Specifies whether not to query the playback URL. If you set this parameter to true, only transcoding metadata is returned. The video is not transcoded in the TS format, and the playback URL is not returned. If you set this parameter to false, the playback URL is returned. If the video has not been transcoded by using the template specified by template_id, the transcoding process is triggered. You are charged for the value-added service fees generated for transcoding.

url_expire_sec.description: The validity period of the video preview. Unit: seconds. Default value: 900. Maximum value: 14400.

identity_type.description:

Batch.summary: Calls multiple operations at a time to improve call efficiency.

resource.description:
The type of the resource that you want to manage. Valid values:

*   file: a file.
*   drive: an individual drive or a team drive.
*   user: a user.
*   group: a group.
*   membership: a group member.
*   share_link: a share.
*   async_task: an asynchronous task.

requests.description:
The child requests.

The number of child requests. Valid value: 1 to 100.

id.description: The ID of the child request. The ID is used to associate a child request with a response. The ID of a child request must be unique.

method.description:
The method of a child request. Valid values:

*   POST
*   GET
*   PUT
*   DELETE
*   HEAD

url.description:
The API path of a child request. Valid values:

*   /file/get: queries the information about a file.
*   /file/update: modifies the information about a file.
*   /file/search: searches for a file.
*   /file/copy: copies a file or folder.
*   /file/move: moves a file or folder.
*   /file/delete: deletes a file or folder.
*   /file/get_download_url: queries the download URL of a file.
*   /file/get_share_link_download_url: queries the download URL of a file in a share.
*   /recyclebin/trash: moves a file or folder to the recycle bin.
*   /recyclebin/restore: restores a file or folder.
*   /file/put_usertags: adds tags to a user.
*   /file/delete_usertags: removes tags from a user.
*   /drive/get: queries the information about a drive.
*   /user/get: queries the information about a user.
*   /group/get: queries the information about a group.
*   /share_link/create: creates a share.
*   /share_link/update: modifies a share.
*   /share_link/cancel: cancels a share.
*   /share_link/list: queries shares.
*   /share_link/get: queries the information about a share.
*   /share_link/get_share_token: queries an access token of a share.
*   /async_task/get: queries the information about an asynchronous task.

query.description:
The fields used for query. You can specify one or more of the following fields:

*   drive_id (space ID, in the form of a string)

*   acted_at (operation time, in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format in UTC, for example, 2006-01-02T00:00:00)
*   action_type (operation type, in the form of a string)

order_by.description:
The sort order based on the operation time. If you leave this parameter empty, the value acted_at DESC is used. Valid values:

*   acted_at DESC: sorts the entries by operation time in descending order
*   acted_at ASC: sorts the entries by operation time in ascending order

file_name.description: The name of the exported file. The name can be up to 1,024 characters in length. The default name suffix is log.csv.

language.description:
The export language. Default value: zh-CN. Valid values:

*   en_US: English
